intro: Palicourea circinata, commonly known as the spiral leaf palicourea, is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, spiral-arranged leaves that give it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or yellow, and it produces small, fleshy berries. Palicourea circinata is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
